H0.text: The size of subatomic particles was the concept most likely modified due to the invention of the microscope.

H1.text: The composition of living things was most likely modified due to the invention of the microscope.

H2.text: The number of the moons of Jupiter was most likely modified due to the invention of the microscope.

H3.text: Formation of sedimentary rocks was most likely modified due to the invention of the microscope.

A4.text: The development of the electron microscope in the 1920s made it possible to view objects that are smaller than optical wavelengths, once again opening up new possibilities in science.

A5.text: The discovery of the cell was made possible through the invention of the microscope.

A6.text: The first detailed account of the microscopic anatomy of organic tissue based on the use of a microscope did not appear until 1644.

A7.text: Van Leeuwenhoek re-discovered red blood cells and helped popularise the use of microscopes to view biological ultrastructure.
